title: How America's tech right came to power
summary: The role of several Silicon Valley billionaires in Donald Trump's re-election as US president, most notably Elon Musk highlights the influence of a new ideological current bridging libertarian utopias and conservative values.

title: Trump names campaign spokeswoman Karoline Leavitt as White House press secretary
summary: Leavitt will become one of the youngest people to take the key position, acting as the face of the White House and fielding questions from the media.

title: In the US, the Republicans' endless war against the federal government
summary: Limiting 'big government' spending has become the new mantra of the right. Since the 1960s, and right up to Donald Trump and his allies, the Republican side has continually denounced the federal government.

title: In Iran, the suicide of opposition figure Kianoosh Sanjari sends shockwaves through social media
summary: Imprisoned and forcibly confined to psychiatric hospitals several times, Sanjari, a human rights activist, blogger and journalist took his own life on Wednesday 'in protest against the dictatorship of Khamenei.'

title: COP29: From aviation to the super-rich, the search for innovative climate financing
summary: To mobilize the huge sums needed to finance ecological transition and adapt to global warming, several countries, including France, are considering new global taxes.

title: Mar-a-Lago, theater of Trumpian power
summary: With the Republican billionaire's re-election on November 5, his property in Palm Beach, Florida is set to become the 'Winter White House' once again.

title: Biden praises cooperation at meeting with South Korean, Japanese leaders: 'I'm proud of how far we've come'
summary: The meeting on the sidelines of the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation summit in Peru comes as North Korea has deployed thousands of troops to Russia to help Moscow try to claw back land in the Kursk border region that Ukraine seized earlier this year.

title: Spanish regional leader admits 'mistakes' in handling floods that killed over 200
summary: Protesters gathered outside as Carlos Mazon, the president of the Valencia region, spoke to the regional parliament.

title: Democratic states prepare to be on front line against Trump's policies
summary: In the absence of a counterweight in Congress, blue states are trying, as they did in 2016, to organize themselves. This time, however, they are not benefiting from popular mobilization.

title: 'Yes, entry to Notre-Dame Cathedral should be charged. And not for €5 – for 20 or 30'
summary: In addition to charging admission to the Parisian edifice, the principle should be extended to France's other major cathedrals because safeguarding French heritage is a 'bottomless pit,' writes Le Monde columnist Michel Guerrin.

title: Scholz urges Ukraine peace talks in first call with Putin since 2022
summary: The German leader 'urged Russia to show willingness to negotiate with Ukraine with the aim of achieving a just and lasting peace,' reported the chancellor's spokesperson.

title: French court orders release of pro-Palestinian militant held since 1984
summary: A French court has ordered the conditional release of Lebanese militant Georges Abdallah, jailed for 40 years in France over the killing of two foreign diplomats. Prosecutors will appeal the decision.

title: 'Gladiator II': An excess of virility and hemoglobin
summary: Set 16 years after the first installment released in 2000, the plot of Ridley Scott's second opus is overwhelmed by its earnestness.

title: Trump nominates RFK Jr. as health secretary and North Dakota Governor Doug Burgum to lead Department of the Interior
summary: After Robert F. Kennedy Jr. abandoned his independent presidential bid and endorsed the Republican, Trump said he would let the vaccine skeptic 'go wild' with health and food policy. The President-elect also announced Thursday that he has chosen former Georgia congressman Doug Collins to run the Department of Veterans Affairs.

title: In Gaza, humanitarian supplies looted right in front of the Israeli army
summary: The humanitarian crisis in the enclave is exacerbated by armed gangs who loot aid trucks just after they have passed through Israeli military roadblocks.

title: Damso: 'I want to find myself in the phase of the student who is learning'
summary: The Belgian artist is releasing a new album, 'J'ai Menti,' ahead of the one he swore would be his last on May 30, 2025. In an interview with Le Monde, the future young rap retiree takes stock of his nine-year career.

title: French student imprisoned in Tunisia for weeks returns to Paris
summary: Victor Dupont was arrested along with two other French nationals on October 19. He was released from prison on Tuesday, before arriving back to France on Friday.

title: French people's sexuality: The many reasons why first intercourse happens a little later
summary: According to the Inserm-ANRS survey published on Wednesday, in 2023, the average 'first time' age was 18.2 years for women and 17.7 for men. But this first intercourse is part of the entry into sexuality, without necessarily being the starting point.

title: Zelensky says Ukraine war will end 'sooner' with Trump in office
summary: The Ukrainian president said he had a 'constructive exchange' with Trump during their telephone conversation after his US presidential election victory.

title: Social services in Sweden could force some young people to wear ankle tags
summary: The right and far right majority want to authorize social services to take coercive measures to prevent the recruitment of minors by gangs and to combat organized crime.

title: In Paris, former artists' studios will soon be turned into large tourist apartments
summary: In a historic alleyway in the 14th arrondissement, residents fear their neighborhood will be transformed into a 'bachelor party location.'

title: The 'visceral' anguish of France's Lebanese community
summary: Since the escalation between Israel and Hezbollah at the end of September, the Lebanese community in France (between 50,000 and 60,000 people) has been keeping a close eye on the media relaying news from the region and sticking together.

title: Tens of thousands flee as Typhoon Man-yi nears Philippines
summary: Man-yi will be the sixth major storm to pound the Philippines in the past month. At least 163 people have died so far from the storms, which have left thousands homeless and have wiped out the country's crops and livestock.

title: Amid the war in Ukraine, the delicate task of appointing a French ambassador to Russia
summary: After much uncertainty, Nicolas de Rivière, the current French representative to the United Nations, has been appointed ambassador to Moscow. However, as is customary, Russia must now grant its approval.

title: EU-Mercosur: Why the French have opposed this free trade agreement
summary: The French government wants to block the free trade agreement between the European Union and five South American countries. Meanwhile, farmers have called for nationwide protests starting on Monday.

title: G7 calls Russia the sole obstacle to 'just and lasting peace' in Ukraine
summary: In a joint statement, the G7 states also stated their 'unwavering support for Ukraine for as long as it takes.' Meanwhile, Ukraine's Volodymyr Zelensky said Kyiv would like a diplomatic end to the war next year.

title: How pro-Trump conservatives built up an alternative media ecosystem through podcasts
summary: Their names are Joe Rogan, Charlie Kirk and Andrew Schulz: In recent months, their conservative podcasts − which have millions of listeners in the US − all hosted Donald Trump and promoted his ideas.

title: War in Lebanon: Children go back to public schools, despite fear of bombardment
summary: Over 200,000 primary and secondary public schoolchildren have gone back to school, whether face-to-face or online. Teachers have been left to their own devices, organizing their classes against a backdrop of war.
